intro: Hieracium fariniramum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and tall, branched stems that bear numerous yellow flower heads. The plant produces both ray and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Hieracium fariniramum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
